title: Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427)
summary: This page provides information about the Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427), which is closed to new applications. It explains the rights and obligations of existing visa holders and sponsors. It also outlines work conditions, family obligations, sponsorship rules, and sponsor compliance requirements.

visa_details.description: This visa allows domestic workers to work in Australia in the household of an executive holding a Business (Long Stay) visa (subclass 457).
visa_details.application_availability: You cannot apply for this visa.

visa_holders_information.purpose: Information for people already granted this visa, including rights and obligations.

visa_validity.duration: valid for the period of the nominated position

permissions: work in Australia as a domestic worker in the household of a Business (Long Stay) visa (subclass 457) holder
stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position (maximum two years)
bring family members (family can work and study)
travel in and out of Australia while the visa is valid
visa_holder_obligations: comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia

must: not stop working for the employer who sponsored the visa
not engage in work inconsistent with the nominated position
not stay in Australia after the permanent departure of the employer
work only in the household of the sponsoring employer

visa_holders_information.changing_sponsor: Changing employers is not permitted on this visa. Visa finder can be used to search for another visa.

entry_and_departure: family cannot enter Australia before the primary visa holder
family must leave Australia when the primary visa holder's visa ends
requirements: must intend to remain part of the family unit
permissions: family can work or study while their visa is valid

changes_to_report: changes to phone number, email, address or passport
change_notification_requirements.consequence_of_not_reporting_passport_ch: significant delays at the airport and possible denial of boarding

sponsor_information.sponsorship_status: cannot apply to sponsor new applicants (visa closed)
sponsor_information.sponsorship_validity: cannot be used to sponsor domestic workers anymore

nomination_end_conditions: day written withdrawal notification is received
3 months after sponsor approval ceases (if nomination approval was given to the sponsor)
day sponsor approval is cancelled (if nomination approval was given to the sponsor)
day on which visa was granted on the basis of the nomination

sponsor_obligations.overview: Sponsors must comply with several obligations, even if someone else acts on their behalf.
obligations: notify authorities when certain events occur
provide records and information when requested
not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
ensure visa holder works in the nominated occupation or activity
pay travel costs for sponsored people to leave Australia
secure reasonable accommodation for the visa holder

inspection_purpose: determine if sponsorship obligations are complied with
determine if illegal workers are employed
determine if administrative action is required

obligation_period.start: day sponsorship is approved or work agreement begins
obligation_period.end: 5 years after sponsorship or work agreement ceases

examples_of_cooperation: not preventing access to individuals or documents
allowing interviews with any person on the premises

requirements: must keep records that show compliance with obligations
records must be reproducible and independently verifiable
must keep copies of all required notifications, including dates, methods, and locations

obligation_period.end: two years after sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: must provide requested records or information within the specified timeframe
must provide records required under Commonwealth, state or territory law
must provide records required as a sponsor

obligation_period.start: day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.end: two years after sponsorship or work agreement ceases and no sponsored visa holders remain

notification_method: written notice sent by registered post or email to a specified address
events_to_report: cessation or expected cessation of primary visa holderâ€™s employment
changes to sponsor address or contact details
